page.title: 06The Spider Bridge, Derby
page.content: The Spider Bridge was built in the early 1970's. It spans the junction of four very busy roads - Osmaston Road, Harvey Road, Osmaston Park Road and Chellaston Road.It is made of steel, with grit on the top where you walk. In the summer the bridge is quite often used, but in the winter it is very slippery. Most people think it is not easy for mothers with prams or old aged pensioners to use. It is called the{Spider Bridge} because it looks like a gigantic spider. It has railings along the side so that no-one falls off, as it is quite high so that lorries and large vehicles can pass underneath. A small number of people get scared crossing the bridge, as it vibrates when heavy lorries pass under it.
